attribute.span: Whether the vertical divisional lines should display as dash.

attribute.name: vDivlineDashLen Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: If the vertical divisional lines are to be displayed as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash.

attribute.name: vDivlineDashGap Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: If the vertical divisional lines are to displayed as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each gap between dash.

attribute.name: showAlternateVGridColor Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Whether to show alternate colored vertical grid bands.

attribute.name: alternateVGridColor Since v3.2.2
attribute.range: Color of the alternate vertical grid bands.

attribute.name: alternateVGridAlpha Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Transparency of the alternate vertical grid bands.

attribute.name: showZeroPlane
attribute.span: Whether to show zero plane.
Zero Plane is the line/plane that appears at 0 y-position on canvas, when negative data is being shown on the chart.

attribute.name: zeroPlaneThickness
attribute.span: Thickness of zero plane.

attribute.name: zeroPlaneAlpha
attribute.span: Alpha of zero plane.

attribute.name: showZeroPlaneValue Since v 3.2.2 - SR3
attribute.span: Allows you to show or hide the value on which the zero plane exists on the y-axis. By default, the value is displayed. This attribute is not supported in JavaScript charts.

attribute.name: showVZeroPlane Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Whether to show vertical zero plane.
Zero Plane is the line/plane that appears at 0 x-position on canvas, when negative data is being shown on the chart.

attribute.name: vZeroPlaneColor Since v3.2.2
attribute.range: Color of the vertical zero plane.

attribute.name: vZeroPlaneThickness Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Thickness of the vertical zero plane.

attribute.name: vZeroPlaneAlpha Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Transparency of the vertical zero plane.

attribute.name: showLegend
attribute.span: Whether to show legend on the chart.

attribute.name: legendPosition
attribute.span: The legend can be plotted at two positions on the chart - below the chart (BOTTOM) and on the RIGHT side of the chart.

attribute.name: legendCaption
attribute.range: You can add a caption for the entire legend by setting the same here.

attrtable.attribute: Scaling of legend icon is possible in FusionCharts XT. This attribute lets you control the size of legend icon.

attribute.name: legendBgColor
attribute.span: Background color for the legend.

attribute.name: legendBgAlpha
attribute.span: Background alpha for the legend.

attribute.name: legendBorderColor
attribute.span: Border Color for the legend.

attribute.name: legendBorderThickness
attribute.span: Border thickness for the legend.

attribute.name: legendBorderAlpha
attribute.span: Border alpha for the legend.

attribute.name: legendShadow
attribute.span: Whether to show a shadow for legend.

attribute.name: legendAllowDrag
attribute.span: The legend can be made drag-able by setting this attribute to 1. End viewers of the chart can drag the legend around on the chart.

attribute.name: legendScrollBgColor
attribute.span: If you've too many items on the legend, a scroll bar shows up on the same. This attribute lets you configure the background color of the scroll bar.

attribute.name: legendScrollBarColor
attribute.span: If you've too many items on the legend, a scroll bar shows up on the same. This attribute lets you configure the bar color of the scroll bar.

attribute.name: legendScrollBtnColor
attribute.span: If you've too many items on the legend, a scroll bar shows up on the same. This attribute lets you configure the color of buttons of the scroll bar.

attribute.name: reverseLegend
attribute.span: You can reverse the ordering of datasets in the legend by setting this attribute to 1.

attrtable.attribute: This attribute lets you interact with the legend in your chart. When you click a legend key, the dataplots associated with that series are eliminated from the chart. Re-clicking the key causes the dataplots to reappear.

If your chart contains multiple series, the legend is displayed as a grid comprising of multiple legend keys. With the help of this attribute you can specify the number of columns that are to be displayed in the legend.
Whether to minimize legend item text wrapping.
Whether to use square legend keys or circular ones.

attribute.name: formatNumber
attribute.span: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if formatNumber='1' and 40000 if formatNumber= '0'. The value of this attribute works only if
yFormatNumber
and
xFormatNumber
attributes are not specifically mentioned. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: yFormatNumber Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the y-axis of the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if formatNumber='1' and 40000 if formatNumber= '0'. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from
formatNumber
attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: xFormatNumber Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the x-axis of the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if formatNumber='1' and 40000 if formatNumber= '0'. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from
formatNumber
attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: formatNumberScale
attribute.span:
Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if formatNumberScale is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end. The value of this attribute works only if
yFormatNumberScale and xFormatNumberScale attributes are not specifically mentioned.For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: yFormatNumberScale Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it on the y-axis - e.g., if
yFormatNumberScale
is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from
formatNumberScale
attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: xFormatNumberScale Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it on the x-axis - e.g., if
xFormatNumberScale
is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from
formatNumberScale
attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: defaultNumberScale
attribute.range: The default unit of the numbers that you're providing to the chart. The value of this attribute works only if yDefaultNumberScale and xDefaultNumberScale attributes are not specifically mentioned.For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: yDefaultNumberScale Since v3.2.2
attribute.range: The default unit of the numbers of the y-axis that you're providing to the chart. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from DefaultNumberScale attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: xDefaultNumberScale Since v3.2.2
attribute.range: The default unit of the numbers of the x-axis that you're providing to the chart. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from DefaultNumberScale attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: numberScaleUnit
attribute.range: Unit of each block of the scale. The value of this attribute works only if yNumberScaleUnit and xNumberScaleUnit attributes are not specifically mentioned. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: yNumberScaleUnit Since v3.2.2
attribute.range: Unit of each block of the scale of the y-axis. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from NumberScaleUnit attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: xNumberScaleUnit Since v3.2.2
attribute.range: Unit of each block of the scale of the x-axis. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from NumberScaleUnit attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: numberScaleValue
attribute.range: Range of the various blocks that constitute the scale. The value of this attribute works only if yNumberScaleValue and xNumberScaleValue attributes are not specifically mentioned. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attrtable.attribute: Whether to scale the number recursively? For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Recursive Number Scaling page.

Whether to scale the number recursively for the x-axis? This attribute will work only if the attribute xAxisLabelMode is set to ' AUTO' or ' MIXED'. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Recursive Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: maxScaleRecursion Since v 3.2.2 - SR3
attribute.range: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling? -1 completes the entire set of recursion. For more details see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting > Recursive Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: xMaxScaleRecursion Since v 3.2.2 - SR3
attribute.range: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling for the numbers on the x-axis? -1 completes the entire set of recursion. For more details see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting > Recursive Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: scaleSeparator Since v 3.2.2 - SR3
attribute.range: What character to use to separate the scales that generated after recursion? For more details see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Recursive Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: xScaleSeparator Since v 3.2.2 - SR3
attribute.range: What character to use to separate the scales that generated after recursion for the numbers on the x-axis? For more details see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Recursive Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: yNumberScaleValue Since v3.2.2
attribute.range: Range of the various blocks that constitute the y-axis scale. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from NumberScaleValue attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: xNumberScaleValue Since v3.2.2
attribute.range: Range of the various blocks that constitute the x-axis scale. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from NumberScaleValue attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: numberPrefix
attribute.span: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' $' to show like $40000, $50000. The value of this attribute works only if yNumberPrefix and xNumberPrefix attributes are not specifically mentioned. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: yNumberPrefix Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the y-axis. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the y-axis, you could specify this attribute to ' $' to show like $40000, $50000. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from NumberPrefix attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: xNumberPrefix Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the x-axis. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the x-axis, you could specify this attribute to ' $' to show like $40000, $50000. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from NumberPrefix attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: numberSuffix
attribute.span: Using this attribute, you could add a suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' /a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a. The value of this attribute works only if yNumberSuffix and xNumberSuffix attributes are not specifically mentioned. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: yNumberSuffix Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Using this attribute, you could add a suffix to all the numbers visible on the y-axis. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the y-axis, you could specify this attribute to ' /a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from NumberSuffix attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: xNumberSuffix Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Using this attribute, you could add a suffix to all the numbers visible on the x-axis. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the x-axis, you could specify this attribute to ' /a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a.If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from NumberSuffix attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: decimalSeparator
attribute.span: This option helps you specify the character to be used as the decimal separator in a number. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: thousandSeparator
attribute.span: This option helps you specify the character to be used as the thousands separator in a number. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: thousandSeparatorPosition Since v 3.2.2 - SR3
attribute.range: This option helps you specify the position of the thousand separator. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting > Basics page.

attribute.name: inDecimalSeparator
attribute.span: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. So, FusionCharts XT accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the decimal separator. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Input Number Formatting page.

attribute.name: inThousandSeparator
attribute.span: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. So, FusionCharts XT accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the thousand separator. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Input Number Formatting page.

attribute.name: decimals
attribute.span: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to.
For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attrtable.attribute: Whether to add 0 padding at the end of decimal numbers. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all the numbers, set this attribute to 1. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

Whether to forcefully attach decimal places to all y-axis values. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all y-axis numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all y-axis numbers, set this attribute to 1. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

Whether to forcefully attach decimal places to all x-axis values. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all x-axis numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all x-axis numbers, set this attribute to 1. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: yAxisValueDecimals
attribute.span: If you've opted to not adjust div lines, you can specify the div line values decimal precision using this attribute.
For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: xAxisValueDecimals Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: If you've opted not to adjust vertical div lines, you can specify the decimal precision of the div line values using this attribute.
For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: baseFont
attribute.span: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart. If you specify
outCnvBaseFont
attribute also, then this attribute controls only the font face of text within the chart canvas bounds.

attribute.name: baseFontSize
attribute.span: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.

attribute.name: baseFontColor
attribute.range: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.

attribute.name: outCnvBaseFont
attribute.span: This attribute sets the base font family of the chart font which lies outside the canvas i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font name provided here.

attribute.name: outCnvBaseFontSize
attribute.span: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.

attribute.name: outCnvBaseFontColor
attribute.range: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.

attribute.name: showToolTip
attribute.span: Whether to show tool tip on chart.

attribute.name: toolTipSepChar
attribute.range: The character specified as the value of this attribute separates the name and value displayed in tool tip.

attribute.name: seriesNameInToolTip
attribute.span: For scatter charts, FusionCharts XT shows the following information in tool tip (unless tool text is explicitly defined): "Series Name, Category Name, Data Value". This attribute lets you control whether series name will show up in tool tip or not.

attrtable.attribute: Whether to show shadow for tool-tips on the chart.

attribute.name: captionPadding
attribute.span: This attribute lets you control the space (in pixels) between the sub-caption and top of the chart canvas. If the sub-caption is not defined, it controls the space between caption and top of chart canvas. If neither caption, nor sub-caption is defined, this padding does not come into play.

attribute.name: xAxisNamePadding
attribute.span: Using this, you can set the distance between the top end of x-axis title and the bottom end of data labels (or canvas, if data labels are not to be shown).

attribute.name: yAxisNamePadding
attribute.span: Using this, you can set the distance between the right end of y-axis title and the start of y-axis values (or canvas, if the y-axis values are not to be shown).

attribute.name: yAxisValuesPadding
attribute.span: This attribute helps you set the horizontal space between the canvas left edge and the y-axis values or trend line values (on left/right side). This is particularly useful, when you want more space between your canvas and y-axis values.

attribute.name: labelPadding
attribute.span: This attribute sets the vertical space between the labels and canvas bottom edge. If you want more space between the canvas and the x-axis labels, you can use this attribute to control it.

attribute.name: chartLeftMargin
attribute.span: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the left side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.

attribute.name: chartRightMargin
attribute.span: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the right side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.

attribute.name: chartTopMargin
attribute.span: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the top of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.

attribute.name: chartBottomMargin
attribute.span: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the bottom of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.

attribute.name: valuePadding
attribute.span: It sets the vertical space between the end of columns and start of value textboxes. This basically helps you control the space you want between your columns/anchors and the value textboxes.

attribute.name: legendPadding
attribute.span: Padding of legend from right/bottom side of canvas

attrtable.attribute:
This attribute lets you control the space between the start of chart canvas and the start (x) of chart. In case of 2D charts, the canvas is the visible rectangular box. In case of 3D charts, the canvas box is the imaginary box around the 3D canvas.
Using this attribute, you can control the amount of empty space between the chart left side and canvas left side. By default, FusionCharts XT automatically calculates this space depending on the elements to be placed on the chart. However, if you want to over-ride this value with a higher value, you can use this attribute to specify the same. Please note that you cannot specify a margin lower than what has been calculated by the chart.This attribute is particularly useful, when you've multiple charts placed in a page and want all their canvas start position to align with each other - so in such a case, you can set same margin value (a value large enough that it doesn't get rejected by chart owing to it being lower than the calculated value) for all such charts in the page.

attribute.name: canvasRightMargin
attribute.span: Like
canvasLeftMargin
, this attribute lets you set the space between end of canvas and end of chart.

attribute.name: canvasTopMargin
attribute.span: Like
canvasLeftMargin
, this attribute lets you set the space between top of canvas and top of chart.

attribute.name: canvasBottomMargin
attribute.span: Like
canvasLeftMargin
, this attribute lets you set the space between bottom of canvas and bottom of chart.

attribute.name: font
attribute.span: Lets you specify font face for the x-axis data labels.

attribute.name: fontSize
attribute.range: Lets you specify font size for the x-axis data labels.

attribute.name: fontColor
attribute.span: Lets you specify font color for the x-axis data labels.

attribute.name: verticalLineColor
attribute.span: In the bubble/scatter chart, you can opt to show vertical lines for each category label. This attribute lets you set the color for all of them.

attribute.name: verticalLineThickness
attribute.span: Lets you set the thickness for category lines.

attribute.name: verticalLineAlpha
attribute.span: Lets you set the alpha for category lines.

attribute.name: verticalLineDashed
attribute.span: Whether the category lines should appear as dashed.

attribute.name: verticalLineDashLen
attribute.span: If the category lines are to appear as dash, this attribute defines the length of dash.

attribute.name: verticalLineDashGap
attribute.span: If the category lines are to appear as dash, this attribute defines the length of gap between two consecutive dashes.

attribute.name: x
attribute.span: The bubble/scatter chart have both x and y axis as numeric. This attribute lets you define the x value (numerical position on the x-axis) where this category name will be placed.

attribute.name: label
attribute.range: This attribute determines the label for the data item. The label appears on the x-axis of chart.

attribute.name: showLabel
attribute.span: You can individually opt to show/hide labels of individual data items using this attribute.

attribute.name: showVerticalLine
attribute.span: Whether the vertical line should be shown for this category.

attribute.name: lineDashed
attribute.span: Whether the vertical line should appear as dashed.

attribute.name: seriesName
attribute.range: Lets you specify the series name for a particular dataset. For example, if you're plotting a chart to indicate monthly sales analysis for 2005 and 2006, the seriesName for the first dataset will be 2005 and that of the second will be 2006. The seriesName of a dataset is shown in legend.

attribute.name: color
attribute.span: This attribute sets the color using which columns, lines, area of that dataset will be drawn. For column chart, you can specify a list of comma separated hex codes to get a gradient plot.

attribute.name: alpha
attribute.span: This attribute sets the alpha (transparency) of the entire dataset.

attribute.name: showValues
attribute.span: Whether to show the values for this dataset.

attribute.name: includeInLegend
attribute.span: Whether to include the seriesName of this dataset in legend.

attribute.name: drawAnchors
attribute.span: Whether to draw anchors for the particular dataset. If the anchors are not shown, then the tool tip and links won't work for the dataset.

attribute.name: anchorSides
attribute.span: Sets the number of sides that the anchors of the particular dataset will have. For e.g., an anchor with 3 sides will represent a triangle, with 4 it will be a square and so on.

attribute.name: anchorRadius
attribute.span: This attribute sets the radius (in pixels) of the anchors of the particular dataset. Greater the radius, bigger will be the anchor size.

attribute.name: anchorBorderColor
attribute.span: Lets you set the border color of anchors of the particular dataset.

attribute.name: anchorBorderThickness
attribute.span: Helps you set border thickness of anchors of the particular dataset.

attribute.name: anchorBgColor
attribute.span: Helps you set the background color of anchors of the particular dataset.

attribute.name: anchorAlpha
attribute.span: Helps you set the alpha of entire anchors of the particular dataset. If you need to hide the anchors for the dataset but still enable tool tips, set this as 0.

attribute.name: anchorBgAlpha
attribute.span: Helps you set the alpha of anchor background of the particular dataset.

attribute.name: drawLine
attribute.span: You can opt to connect the scatter points of any dataset using lines. This attribute helps you configure that.

attribute.name: lineColor
attribute.span: Color of the line connecting the scatter points.

attribute.name: lineAlpha
attribute.span: Alpha of the lines connecting the scatter points.

attribute.name: lineThickness
attribute.span: Thickness of the lines for the particular dataset.

attribute.name: lineDashed
attribute.span: Configuration Whether to show the lines connecting the scatter points as dash.

attribute.name: lineDashLen
attribute.span: If the lines are to be shown as dash for the particular dataset, this attribute defines the length of dash.

attribute.name: lineDashGap
attribute.span: If the lines are to be shown as dash for the particular dataset, this attribute defines the length of dash gap.

attribute.name: showRegressionLine Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: This attribute when set to '1' draws a regression line for the corresponding <dataset> element in the chart.

attribute.name: showYOnX Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: When it is set to '1' the regression line is drawn using Y On X mode and when the attribute is set to '0' the regression line is drawn using X On Y mode. By default, this attribute is set to '1'.

attribute.name: RegressionLineColor Since v3.2.2
attribute.range: This attribute allows you to set the color of the regression line.

attribute.name: RegressionLineThickness Since v3.2.2
attribute.range: This attribute allows you to set the thickness of the regression line.

attribute.name: RegressionLineAlpha Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: This attribute allows you to set the transparency of the regression line.

attribute.name: x
attribute.span: X-axis value for the set. The bubble/scatter point will be placed horizontally on the x-axis based on this value.

attribute.name: y
attribute.span: Y-axis value for the set. The bubble/scatter point will be placed vertically on the y-axis based on this value.

attribute.name: displayValue
attribute.range: If instead of the numerical value of this data, you wish to display a custom string value, you can specify the same here. Examples are annotation for a data item etc.

attribute.name: link
attribute.range: You can define links for individual data items. That enables the end user to click on data items (columns, lines, bars etc.) and drill down to other pages. To define the link for data items, use the link attribute. You can define links that open in same window, new window, pop-up window or frames. Please see " Drill Down Charts >FusionCharts Link format" for more information. Also, you'll need to URL Encode all the special characters (like ? and &) present in the link.

attribute.name: toolText
attribute.range: By default, FusionCharts XT shows the series Name, Category Name and value as tool tip text for that data item. But, if you want to display more information for the data item as tool tip, you can use this attribute to specify the same.

attribute.name: showValue
attribute.span: You can individually opt to show/hide values of individual data items using this attribute. This value over-rides the dataset level value.

attribute.name: startValue
attribute.span: The starting value for the trendline. Say, if you want to plot a slanted trendline from value 102 to 109, the
startValue
will be 102.

attribute.name: endValue
attribute.span: endValue
will be 109. If you do not specify a value for
endValue
, it will automatically assume the same value as
startValue

attribute.name: displayValue
attribute.range: If you want to display a string caption for the trend line by its side, you can use this attribute. Example: displayValue='Last Month High' . When you don't supply this attribute, it automatically takes the value of startValue .

attribute.name: color
attribute.span: Color of the trend line and its associated text.

attribute.name: isTrendZone
attribute.span: Whether the trend will display a line, or a zone (filled colored rectangle).

attribute.name: thickness
attribute.span: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define the thickness of trend line.

attribute.name: alpha
attribute.span: Alpha of the trend line.

attribute.name: dashed
attribute.span: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define whether the trend line will appear as dashed.

attribute.name: dashLen
attribute.span: If you've opted to show trend line as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash.

attribute.name: dashGap
attribute.span: If you've opted to show trend line as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash gap.

attribute.name: startValue
attribute.span: The starting value for the trendline. Say, if you want to plot a slanted trendline from value 102 to 109, the
startValue
will be 102.

attribute.name: endValue
attribute.span: endValue
will be 109. If you do not specify a value for
endValue
, it will automatically assume the same value as
startValue

attribute.name: displayValue
attribute.range: If you want to display a string caption for the trend line by its side, you can use this attribute. Example: displayValue='Last Month High' . When you don't supply this attribute, it automatically takes the value of startValue .

attribute.name: color
attribute.span: Color of the trend line and its associated text.

attribute.name: isTrendZone
attribute.span: Whether the trend will display a line, or a zone (filled colored rectangle).

attribute.name: showOnTop
attribute.span: Whether the trend line/zone will be displayed over data plots or under them.

attribute.name: thickness
attribute.span: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define the thickness of trend line.

attribute.name: alpha
attribute.span: Alpha of the trend line.

attribute.name: dashed
attribute.span: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define whether the trend line will appear as dashed.

attribute.name: dashLen
attribute.span: If you've opted to show trend line as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash.

attribute.name: dashGap
attribute.span: If you've opted to show trend line as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash gap.

attribute.name: valueOnRight
attribute.span: Whether to show the trend line value on left side or right side of chart. This is particularly useful when the trend line display values on the chart are colliding with divisional lines values on the chart.

attribute.name: numVisiblePlot
attribute.range: 2-number of data items present in XML

attrtable.attribute:
This attribute lets you control how many data plots will appear in the visible area of the scroll pane.
For example, if you're plotting a chart with 25 data items in each dataset, and you wish to show only 10 data items in the visible area, set this attribute as 10. You will now see only 10 data points on the chart - rest of the data points will be visible upon scrolling.
If you want to show all the data points on the chart irrespective of the number of data points in your XML data document, set this attribute as 0.

attribute.name: animation
attribute.span: This attribute gives you the option to control animation in your charts. If you do not want to animate any part of the chart, set this as 0.

attribute.name: palette
attribute.span: FusionCharts XT uses the concept of Color Palettes. Each chart has 5 pre-defined color palettes which you can choose from. Each palette renders the chart in a different color theme. Valid values are 1-5.

attribute.name: paletteColors
attribute.range: List of hex color codes separated by comma

attrtable.attribute:
While the palette attribute allows to select a palette theme that applies to chart background, canvas, font and tool-tips, it does not change the colors of data items (i.e., column, line, pie etc.). Using paletteColors attribute, you can specify your custom list of hex colors for the data items. The list of colors have to be separated by comma e.g., <chart paletteColors='FF0000,0372AB,FF5904...'>. The chart will cycle through the list of specified colors and then render the data plot accordingly.
To use the same set of colors throughout all your charts in a web application, you can store the list of palette colors in your application globally and then provide the same in each chart XML.

Setting this to 1 shows up a custom context menu in the chart, which can be customized to show your text and can be linked to your Url. For e.g., you can set the context menu of the chart to include "About your company name" and then link to your company home page. By default, the chart shows "About FusionCharts" when right clicked.

attribute.name: aboutMenuItemLabel
attribute.range: The menu item label for the custom context menu item.

attrtable.attribute: Link for the custom context menu item. You can specify the link in FusionCharts Link format to be able to open the same in new window, pop-ups, frames or as JavaScript links.

attribute.name: connectNullData
attribute.span: This attribute lets you control whether empty data sets in your data will be connected to each other OR do they appear as broken data sets. Please see Advanced charting >Plotting Discontinuous data section for more details on this.

attribute.name: showLabels
attribute.span: It sets the configuration whether the x-axis labels will be displayed or not.

attribute.name: labelDisplay
attribute.range:
AUTO
Since v 3.2WRAP STAGGER ROTATE or NONE

attrtable.attribute: Using this attribute, you can customize the alignment of data labels (x-axis labels). There are 5 options: AUTO, WRAP, STAGGER, ROTATE or NONE. By default, this attribute is set to AUTO mode which means that the alignment of the data labels is determined automatically depending on the size of the chart. WRAP wraps the label text if it is too long to fit in one line. ROTATE rotates the labels vertically. STAGGER divides the labels into multiple lines.
When enabled in auto mode, long data labels are truncated by adding ellipses to prevent them from overflowing the chart background. The default value is 1.

attribute.name: rotateLabels
attribute.span: This attribute lets you set whether the data labels will show up as rotated labels on the chart.

attribute.name: slantLabels
attribute.span: If you've opted to show rotated labels on chart, this attribute lets you set the configuration whether the labels will show as slanted labels or fully vertical ones.

attribute.name: labelStep
attribute.span: By default, all the labels are displayed on the chart. However, if you've a set of streaming data (like name of months or days of week), you can opt to show every n-th label for better clarity. This attribute just lets you do so. When a value greater than 1 (n) is set to this attribute, the first label from left and every label at the n-th position from left will be displayed. e.g., a chart showing data for 12 months and set with
labelStep='3'
will show labels for January, April, July and October. The rest of the labels will be skipped.

attribute.name: staggerLines
attribute.span: If you've opted for STAGGER mode as
labelDisplay
, using this attribute you can control how many lines to stagger the label to. By default, all labels are displayed in a single line.

attribute.name: showValues
attribute.span: Sets the configuration whether data values will be displayed along with the data plot on chart.

attrtable.attribute: If you've opted to show data values on the chart, this attribute lets you adjust the vertical alignment of data values with respect to dataplots. By default, this attribute is set to AUTO mode in which the alignment of each data value is determined automatically based on the position of each plot point. In ABOVE mode, data values are displayed above the plot points unless a plot point is too close to the upper edge of the canvas while in BELOW mode, data values are displayed below the plot points unless a plot point is too close to the lower edge of the canvas.

attribute.name: rotateValues
attribute.span: If you've opted to show data values, you can rotate them using this attribute.

attribute.name: showYAxisValues
attribute.span: FusionCharts XT y-axis is divided into vertical sections using div (divisional) lines. Each div line assumes a value based on its position. Using this attribute you can set whether to show those div line (y-axis) values or not. This attribute shows or hides the y-axis divisional lines and limits. The values of
showLimits
and
showDivLineValues
if specified explicitly overrides the value of this attribute.

attribute.name: showLimits
attribute.span: Whether to show chart limit values. If not specified
showYAxisValues
attribute overrides this value.

attribute.name: showDivLineValues
attribute.span: Whether to show div line values. If not specified
showYAxisValues
attribute overrides this value.

attribute.name: defaultAnimation
attribute.span: By default, each chart animates some of its elements. If you wish to switch off the default animation patterns, you can set this attribute to 0. It can be particularly useful when you want to define your own animation patterns using STYLE feature.

attribute.name: yAxisMaxValue
attribute.range: This attribute helps you explicitly set the upper limit of the chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by FusionCharts XT based on the data provided by you.

attribute.name: yAxisMinValue
attribute.range: This attribute helps you explicitly set the lower limit of the chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by FusionCharts XT based on the data provided by you.

attribute.name: yAxisNameWidth
attribute.span: If you opt to not rotate y-axis name, you can choose a maximum width that will be applied to y-axis name.

attribute.name: clickURL
attribute.range: The entire chart can now act as a hotspot. Use this URL to define the hotspot link for the chart. The link can be specified in FusionCharts Link format.

attribute.name: yAxisValuesStep
attribute.span: By default, all div lines show their values. However, you can opt to display every x(th) div line value using this attribute.

attribute.name: showShadow
attribute.span: Whether to show shadows for data plot.

attribute.name: adjustDiv
attribute.span: FusionCharts XT automatically tries to adjust divisional lines and limit values based on the data provided. However, if you want to set your explicit lower and upper limit values and number of divisional lines, first set this attribute to false. That will disable automatic adjustment of divisional lines.

attribute.name: rotateYAxisName
attribute.span: If you do not wish to rotate y-axis name, set this as 0. It specifically comes to use when you've special characters (UTF8) in your y-axis name that do not show up in rotated mode.

attribute.name: setAdaptiveYMin
attribute.span: This attribute lets you set whether the y-axis lower limit will be 0 (in case of all positive values on chart) or should the y-axis lower limit adapt itself to a different figure based on values provided to the chart.

attrtable.attribute: When the chart renders, you can opt to scroll to the end of the chart (to show data at extreme right) by setting this attribute as 1.

attribute.name: centerYaxisName Since v 3.2.2
attribute.span: This attribute when set to '1', allows you to align the y-axis name with respect to the height of the chart. When set to '0', the y-axis name is aligned with respect to the height of the canvas.

attribute.name: showBorder
attribute.span: Whether to show a border around the chart or not.

attribute.name: borderThickness
attribute.span: Border thickness of the chart.

attribute.name: borderAlpha
attribute.span: Border alpha of the chart.

attribute.name: bgColor
attribute.range: This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute. To specify a gradient as background color, separate the hex color codes of each color in the gradient using comma. Example: FF5904,FFFFFF. Remember to remove # and any spaces in between. See Advanced charting >Using Gradients page for more details.

attribute.name: bgAlpha
attribute.span: Sets the alpha (transparency) for the background. If you've opted for gradient background, you need to set a list of alpha(s) separated by comma. See Advanced charting >Using Gradients page for more details.

attribute.name: bgRatio
attribute.span: If you've opted for a gradient background, this attribute lets you set the ratio of each color constituent. See Advanced charting >Using Gradients page for more details.

attribute.name: bgAngle
attribute.span: Sets the angle of the background color, in case of a gradient. See Advanced charting >Using Gradients page for more details.

attribute.name: bgImage or bgSWF - deprecated
attribute.range:
To place any image (JPG/PNG/GIF) or Flash movie (SWF) as background of the chart, enter the (path and) name of the background image or SWF file. It should be in the same domain as the chart.
Loading of Flash movie is deprecated and is not supported by JavaScript charts.

attribute.name: bgImageAlpha or bgSWFAlpha - deprecated
attribute.span: Helps you specify alpha for the loaded background image or Flash movie.

p.span: Loading of Flash movie is deprecated and is not supported by JavaScript charts.

attribute.name: bgImageDisplayMode Since v3.2.2
attribute.range: stretch, tile, fit, fill, center, none

attrtable.attribute:
Helps you specify the mode in which the background image is to be displayed.
Stretch - expands the image to fit the entire chart area, without maintaining original image constraints
Tile - the image is repeated as a pattern on the entire chart area
Fit - fits the image proportionately on the chart area
Fill -proportionately fills the entire chart area with the image
Center - the image is positioned at the center of the chart area
None - Default mode. None of the above modes are applied
For more details click here.

attribute.name: bgImageVAlign Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Helps you to vertically align the background image.

attribute.name: bgImageHAlign Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Helps you to horizontally align the background image.

attribute.name: bgImageScale Since v3.2.2
attribute.span: Helps you magnify the background image.This attribute will only work when the attribute
bgImageDisplayMode
is set to none, center or tile.

attribute.name: canvasBgColor
attribute.range: Sets Canvas background color. For Gradient effect, enter colors separated by comma.

attribute.name: canvasBgAlpha
attribute.range: Sets alpha for Canvas Background. For gradient, enter alpha list separated by commas.

attribute.name: canvasBgRatio
attribute.span: Helps you specify canvas background ratio for gradients.

attribute.name: canvasBgAngle
attribute.range: Helps you specify canvas background angle in case of gradient.

attribute.name: canvasBorderColor
attribute.range: Lets you specify canvas border color.

attribute.name: canvasBorderThickness
attribute.span: Lets you specify canvas border thickness.

attribute.name: canvasBorderAlpha
attribute.span: Lets you control transparency of canvas border.

attribute.name: showVLineLabelBorder
attribute.span: If you've opted to show a label for any of your vLines in the chart, you can collectively configure whether to show border for all such labels using this attribute. If you want to show label border for just a particular vLine, you can over-ride this value by specifying border configuration for that specific vLine.

attribute.name: logoURL
attribute.span: You can load an external logo (JPEG/PNG/SWF) on the chart once it has rendered. This attribute lets you specify the URL of the same. Owing to Flash Player security settings, you can only specify logo that are on the same sub-domain as that of the SWF file of the chart.

attrtable.attribute:
Where to position the logo on the chart:
TL - Top-left
TR - Top-right
BR - Bottom right
BL - Bottom left
CC - Center of screen

attribute.name: logoAlpha
attribute.span: Once the logo has loaded on the chart, you can configure its opacity using this attribute.

attribute.name: logoScale
attribute.span: You can also change the scale of externally loaded logo at run-time by specifying a value for this parameter.

attribute.name: logoLink
attribute.span: If you want to link the logo to an external URL, specify the link in this attribute. The link can be in FusionCharts Link format, allowing you to link to new windows, pop-ups, frames etc.

attribute.name: lineColor
attribute.span: Color using which the lines on the chart will be drawn.

attribute.name: lineThickness
attribute.span: Thickness of the lines on the chart.

attribute.name: lineAlpha
attribute.span: Alpha of the lines on the chart.

attribute.name: lineDashed
attribute.span: Configuration whether to show the lines on the chart as dash.

attribute.name: lineDashLen
attribute.span: If the lines are to be shown as dashes, this attribute defines the length of dash.

attribute.name: lineDashGap
attribute.span: If the lines are to be shown as dashes, this attribute defines the length of dash gap.

attribute.name: scrollColor
attribute.span: Color for scroll bar.

attribute.name: scrollHeight
attribute.span: Required height for scroll bar.

attribute.name: scrollPadding
attribute.span: Distance between the end of canvas (bottom part) and start of scroll bar.
attribute.p: This feature is not available in JavaScript charts.

attribute.name: scrollBtnWidth
attribute.span: Width of both scroll bar buttons (left & right).
attribute.p: This feature is not available in JavaScript charts.

attribute.name: scrollBtnPadding
attribute.span: Padding between the scroll buttons and the scroll track (background).
attribute.p: This feature is not available in JavaScript charts.

attribute.name: drawAnchors
attribute.span: Whether to draw anchors on the chart. If the anchors are not shown, then the tool tip and links won't work.

attribute.name: anchorSides
attribute.span: This attribute sets the number of sides the anchor will have. For e.g., an anchor with 3 sides will represent a triangle, with 4 it will be a square and so on.

attribute.name: anchorRadius
attribute.span: This attribute sets the radius (in pixels) of the anchor. Greater the radius, bigger will be the anchor size.

attribute.name: anchorBorderColor
attribute.span: Lets you set the border color of anchors.

attribute.name: anchorBorderThickness
attribute.span: Helps you set border thickness of anchors.

attribute.name: anchorBgColor
attribute.span: Helps you set the background color of anchors.

attribute.name: anchorAlpha
attribute.span: Helps you set the alpha of entire anchors. If you need to hide the anchors on chart but still enable tool tips, set this as 0.

attribute.name: anchorBgAlpha
attribute.span: Helps you set the alpha of anchor background.

attribute.name: showZeroPlane
attribute.span: Whether to show the zero plane on chart (if negative values are present).

attribute.name: numVDivLines
attribute.range: Number of vertical axis division lines

attribute.name: vDivLineColor
attribute.range: Color of vertical axis division lines.

attribute.name: vDivLineThickness
attribute.span: Thickness of vertical axis division lines.

attribute.name: vDivLineAlpha
attribute.span: Alpha of vertical axis division lines.

attribute.name: vDivLineIsDashed
attribute.span: Whether vertical divisional lines appear as dashed.

attribute.name: vDivLineDashLen
attribute.span: If vertical div lines are dashed, this attribute lets you control the width of dash.

attribute.name: vDivLineDashGap
attribute.span: If vertical div lines are dashed, this attribute lets you control the width of dash gap.

attribute.name: showAlternateVGridColor
attribute.span: Whether to show alternate vertical colored grid bands.

attribute.name: alternateVGridColor
attribute.range: Color of alternate vertical colored grid bands.

attribute.name: alternateVGridAlpha
attribute.range: Alpha of alternate vertical colored grid bands.

attribute.name: numDivLines
attribute.span: Number of horizontal axis division lines that you want on the chart.

attribute.name: divLineThickness
attribute.span: Thickness of divisional lines.

attribute.name: divLineAlpha
attribute.span: Alpha of divisional lines.

attribute.name: divLineIsDashed
attribute.span: Whether the divisional lines should display as dash.

attribute.name: divLineDashLen
attribute.span: If the divisional lines are to be displayed as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash.

attribute.name: divLineDashGap
attribute.span: If the divisional lines are to be displayed as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each gap between dash.

attribute.name: zeroPlaneColor
attribute.range: Color for the Zero Plane. Zero Plane is the line/plane that appears at 0 y-position on canvas, when negative data is being shown on the chart.

attribute.name: zeroPlaneThickness
attribute.span: Thickness of zero plane.

attribute.name: zeroPlaneAlpha
attribute.span: Alpha of zero plane.

attribute.name: showZeroPlaneValue Since v 3.2.2 - SR3
attribute.span: Allows you to show or hide the value on which the zero plane exists on the y-axis. By default, the value is displayed. This attribute is not supported in JavaScript charts.

attribute.name: showAlternateHGridColor
attribute.span: Whether to show alternate colored horizontal grid bands.

attribute.name: alternateHGridColor
attribute.range: Color of the alternate horizontal grid bands.

attribute.name: alternateHGridAlpha
attribute.range: Alpha (transparency) of the alternate horizontal grid bands.

attribute.name: showLegend
attribute.span: Whether to show legend on the chart.

attribute.name: legendPosition
attribute.span: The legend can be plotted at two positions on the chart - below the chart (BOTTOM) and on the RIGHT side of the chart.

attribute.name: legendCaption
attribute.range: You can add a caption for the entire legend by setting the same here.

attrtable.attribute: Scaling of legend icon is possible in FusionCharts XT. This attribute lets you control the size of legend icon.

attribute.name: legendBgColor
attribute.span: Background color for the legend.

attribute.name: legendBgAlpha
attribute.span: Background alpha for the legend.

attribute.name: legendBorderColor
attribute.span: Border Color for the legend.

attribute.name: legendBorderThickness
attribute.span: Border thickness for the legend.

attribute.name: legendBorderAlpha
attribute.span: Border alpha for the legend.

attribute.name: legendShadow
attribute.span: Whether to show a shadow for legend.

attribute.name: legendAllowDrag
attribute.span: The legend can be made drag-able by setting this attribute to 1. End viewers of the chart can drag the legend around on the chart.

attribute.name: legendScrollBgColor
attribute.span: If you've too many items on the legend, a scroll bar shows up on the same. This attribute lets you configure the background color of the scroll bar.

attribute.name: legendScrollBarColor
attribute.span: If you've too many items on the legend, a scroll bar shows up on the same. This attribute lets you configure the bar color of the scroll bar.

attribute.name: legendScrollBtnColor
attribute.span: If you've too many items on the legend, a scroll bar shows up on the same. This attribute lets you configure the color of buttons of the scroll bar.

attribute.name: reverseLegend
attribute.span: You can reverse the ordering of datasets in the legend by setting this attribute to 1.

attrtable.attribute: This attribute lets you interact with the legend in your chart. When you click a legend key, the dataplots associated with that series are eliminated from the chart. Re-clicking the key causes the dataplots to reappear.

If your chart contains multiple series, the legend is displayed as a grid comprising of multiple legend keys. With the help of this attribute you can specify the number of columns that are to be displayed in the legend.
Whether to minimize legend item text wrapping.
Whether to use square legend keys or circular ones.

attribute.name: formatNumber
attribute.span: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if formatNumber='1' and 40000 if formatNumber= '0'. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: formatNumberScale
attribute.span: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if formatNumberScale is set to 1, 10434 will become 1.04K (with decimalPrecision set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: defaultNumberScale
attribute.range: The default unit of the numbers that you're providing to the chart. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: numberScaleUnit
attribute.range: Unit of each block of the scale.For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: numberScaleValue
attribute.range: Range of the various blocks that constitute the scale. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Number Scaling page.

attrtable.attribute: Whether to scale the number recursively? For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Recursive Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: maxScaleRecursion Since v 3.2.2 - SR3
attribute.range: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling? -1 completes the entire set of recursion. For more details see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting > Recursive Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: scaleSeparator Since v 3.2.2 - SR3
attribute.range: What character to use to separate the scales that generated after recursion? For more details see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Recursive Number Scaling page.

attribute.name: numberPrefix
attribute.span: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' $' to show like $40000, $50000. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: numberSuffix
attribute.span: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' /a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: decimalSeparator
attribute.span: This option helps you specify the character to be used as the decimal separator in a number. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: thousandSeparator
attribute.span: This option helps you specify the character to be used as the thousands separator in a number. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: thousandSeparatorPosition Since v 3.2.2 - SR3
attribute.range: This option helps you specify the position of the thousand separator. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting > Basics page.

attribute.name: inDecimalSeparator
attribute.span: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. So, FusionCharts XT accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the decimal separator. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Input Number Formatting page.

attribute.name: inThousandSeparator
attribute.span: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. So, FusionCharts XT accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the thousand separator. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Input Number Formatting page.

attribute.name: decimals
attribute.span: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to.
For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attrtable.attribute: Whether to add 0 padding at the end of decimal numbers. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all the numbers, set this attribute to 1. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

Whether to forcefully attach decimal places to all y-axis values. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all y-axis numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all y-axis numbers, set this attribute to 1. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: yAxisValueDecimals
attribute.span: If you've opted to not adjust div lines, you can specify the div line values decimal precision using this attribute. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting >Basics page.

attribute.name: baseFont
attribute.span: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart. If you specify
outCnvBaseFont
attribute also, then this attribute controls only the font face of text within the chart canvas bounds.

attribute.name: baseFontSize
attribute.span: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.

attribute.name: baseFontColor
attribute.range: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.

attribute.name: outCnvBaseFont
attribute.span: This attribute sets the base font family of the chart font which lies outside the canvas i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font name provided here.

attribute.name: outCnvBaseFontSize
attribute.span: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.

attribute.name: outCnvBaseFontColor
attribute.range: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.

attribute.name: showToolTip
attribute.span: Whether to show tool tip on chart.

attribute.name: toolTipSepChar
attribute.range: The character specified as the value of this attribute separates the name and value displayed in tool tip.

attribute.name: seriesNameInToolTip
attribute.span: For scroll charts, FusionCharts XT shows the following information in tool tip (unless tool text is explicitly defined): "Series Name, Category Name, Data Value". This attribute lets you control whether series name will show up in tool tip or not.

attrtable.attribute: Whether to show shadow for tool-tips on the chart.

attribute.name: captionPadding
attribute.span: This attribute lets you control the space (in pixels) between the sub-caption and top of the chart canvas. If the sub-caption is not defined, it controls the space between caption and top of chart canvas. If neither caption, nor sub-caption is defined, this padding does not come into play.

attribute.name: xAxisNamePadding
attribute.span: Using this, you can set the distance between the top end of x-axis title and the bottom end of data labels (or canvas, if data labels are not to be shown).

attribute.name: yAxisNamePadding
attribute.span: Using this, you can set the distance between the right end of y-axis title and the start of y-axis values (or canvas, if the y-axis values are not to be shown).

attribute.name: yAxisValuesPadding
attribute.span: This attribute helps you set the horizontal space between the canvas left edge and the y-axis values or trend line values (on left/right side). This is particularly useful, when you want more space between your canvas and y-axis values.

attribute.name: labelPadding
attribute.span: This attribute sets the vertical space between the labels and canvas bottom edge. If you want more space between the canvas and the x-axis labels, you can use this attribute to control it.

attribute.name: valuePadding
attribute.span: It sets the vertical space between the end of columns and start of value textboxes. This basically helps you control the space you want between your columns/anchors and the value textboxes.

attribute.name: chartLeftMargin
attribute.span: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the left side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.

attribute.name: chartRightMargin
attribute.span: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the right side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.

attribute.name: chartTopMargin
attribute.span: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the top of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.

attribute.name: chartBottomMargin
attribute.span: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the bottom of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.

attribute.name: canvasPadding
attribute.span: Lets you set the space between the canvas border and first & last data points

attribute.name: legendPadding
attribute.span: Padding of legend from right/bottom side of canvas

attrtable.attribute:
This attribute lets you control the space between the start of chart canvas and the start (x) of chart. In case of 2D charts, the canvas is the visible rectangular box. In case of 3D charts, the canvas box is the imaginary box around the 3D canvas.
Using this attribute, you can control the amount of empty space between the chart left side and canvas left side. By default, FusionCharts XT automatically calculates this space depending on the elements to be placed on the chart. However, if you want to over-ride this value with a higher value, you can use this attribute to specify the same. Please note that you cannot specify a margin lower than what has been calculated by the chart.This attribute is particularly useful, when you've multiple charts placed in a page and want all their canvas start position to align with each other - so in such a case, you can set same margin value (a value large enough that it doesn't get rejected by chart owing to it being lower than the calculated value) for all such charts in the page.

attribute.name: canvasRightMargin
attribute.span: Like
canvasLeftMargin
, this attribute lets you set the space between end of canvas and end of chart.

attribute.name: canvasTopMargin
attribute.span: Like
canvasLeftMargin
, this attribute lets you set the space between top of canvas and top of chart.

attribute.name: canvasBottomMargin
attribute.span: Like
canvasLeftMargin
, this attribute lets you set the space between bottom of canvas and bottom of chart.

attribute.name: font
attribute.span: Lets you specify font face for the x-axis data labels.

attribute.name: fontSize
attribute.range: Lets you specify font size for the x-axis data labels.

attribute.name: fontColor
attribute.span: Lets you specify font color for the x-axis data labels.

attribute.name: label
attribute.range: This attribute determines the label for the data item. The label appears on the x-axis of chart.

attribute.name: showLabel
attribute.span: You can individually opt to show/hide labels of individual data items using this attribute.

attribute.name: toolText
attribute.range: The tooltip defined in the <category> element appears only when the mouse cursor is hovered over the data plots. However, this will not appear when the cursor is moved over the data labels (except for a situation when long labels are automatically truncated with ellipses. In this situation, if the mouse cursor is hovered over a truncated label, the tooltip will appear with the full label). In case you want to set a short label and show the full label in tooltip, define the full label using this attribute within the <category> element. The tooltip with the full label will appear only when the mouse is hovered on the dataplot.

attribute.name: seriesName
attribute.range: Lets you specify the series name for a particular dataset. For example, if you're plotting a chart to indicate monthly sales analysis for 2005 and 2006, the seriesName for the first dataset will be 2005 and that of the second will be 2006. The seriesName of a dataset is shown in legend.

attribute.name: color
attribute.span: This attribute sets the color using which columns, lines, area of that dataset will be drawn. For column chart, you can specify a list of comma separated hex codes to get a gradient plot.

attribute.name: alpha
attribute.span: This attribute sets the alpha (transparency) of the entire dataset.

attribute.name: showValues
attribute.span: Whether to show the values for this dataset.

attrtable.attribute: This attribute lets you adjust the vertical alignment of data values for all dataplots in the dataset. The alignment is set with respect to the position of the dataplots on the chart. By default, the attribute is set to AUTO mode in which the alignment of each data value is determined automatically based on the position of each plot point. In ABOVE mode, data values are displayed above the plot points unless a plot point is too close to the upper edge of the canvas. While in BELOW mode, data values are displayed below the plot points unless a plot point is too close to the lower edge of the canvas. The attribute will function only if showValue attribute is set to 1 in this particular dataset.

attribute.name: dashed
attribute.span: Whether this dataset will appear as dashed.

attribute.name: includeInLegend
attribute.span: Whether to include the series name of this dataset in legend.

attribute.name: drawAnchors
attribute.span: Whether to draw anchors for the particular dataset. If the anchors are not shown, then the tool tip and links won't work for the dataset.

attribute.name: anchorSides
attribute.span: Sets the number of sides that the anchors of the particular dataset will have. For e.g., an anchor with 3 sides will represent a triangle, with 4 it will be a square and so on.

attribute.name: anchorRadius
attribute.span: This attribute sets the radius (in pixels) of the anchors of the particular dataset. Greater the radius, bigger will be the anchor size.

attribute.name: lineThickness
attribute.span: Thickness of the lines for the particular dataset.

attribute.name: lineDashLen
attribute.span: If the lines are to be shown as dash for the particular dataset, this attribute defines the length of dash.

attribute.name: lineDashGap
attribute.span: If the lines are to be shown as dash for the particular dataset, this attribute defines the length of dash gap.

attribute.name: anchorBorderColor
attribute.span: Lets you set the border color of anchors of the particular dataset.

attribute.name: anchorBorderThickness
attribute.span: Helps you set border thickness of anchors of the particular dataset.

attribute.name: anchorBgColor
attribute.span: Helps you set the background color of anchors of the particular dataset.

attribute.name: anchorAlpha
attribute.span: Helps you set the alpha of entire anchors of the particular dataset. If you need to hide the anchors for the dataset but still enable tool tips, set this as 0.

attribute.name: anchorBgAlpha
attribute.span: Helps you set the alpha of anchor background of the particular dataset.

attribute.name: value
attribute.range: Numerical value for the data item. This value will be plotted on the chart.

attribute.name: displayValue
attribute.range: If instead of the numerical value of this data, you wish to display a custom string value, you can specify the same here. Examples are annotation for a data item etc.

attribute.name: color
attribute.span: For scroll charts, you can define the color of datasets at dataset level. However, if you wish to highlight a particular data element, you can specify its color at "set" level using this attribute. This attribute accepts hex color codes without #.

attribute.name: link
attribute.range: You can define links for individual data items. That enables the end user to click on data items (columns, lines, bars etc.) and drill down to other pages. To define the link for data items, use the link attribute. You can define links that open in same window, new window, pop-up window or frames. Please see " Drill Down Charts >FusionCharts Link format" for more information. Also, you'll need to URL Encode all the special characters (like ? and &) present in the link.

attribute.name: toolText
attribute.range: By default, FusionCharts XT shows the series Name, Category Name and value as tool tip text for that data item. But, if you want to display more information for the data item as tool tip, you can use this attribute to specify the same.

attribute.name: showValue
attribute.span: You can individually opt to show/hide values of individual data items using this attribute. This value over-rides the dataset level value.

attrtable.attribute: If you've opted to show a particular data value on the chart, this attribute lets you adjust the vertical alignment of individual data values with respect to dataplots. By default, this attribute is set to AUTO mode in which the alignment of a data value is determined automatically based on the position of its plot point. In ABOVE mode, a data value is displayed above the plot point unless a plot point is too close to the upper edge of the canvas while in BELOW mode, a data value is displayed below the plot point unless a plot point is too close to the lower edge of the canvas.

attribute.name: dashed
attribute.span: Whether the border of this data item should appear as dashed. This is particularly useful when you want to highlight a data (such as forecast or trend etc.). This value over-rides the dataset level value.

attribute.name: alpha
attribute.span: For scroll charts, you can define the alpha of datasets at dataset level. However, if you wish to highlight a particular data element, you can specify its alpha at "set" level using this attribute.

attribute.name: anchorBgAlpha
attribute.span: Lets you specify "set" specific alpha of the anchor background.

attribute.name: anchorBgColor
attribute.span: Lets you specify "set" specific background color of the anchor.

attribute.name: anchorAlpha
attribute.span: Lets you specify "set" specific alpha of the anchor.

attribute.name: anchorSides
attribute.span: Lets you specify "set" specific sides of the anchor.

attribute.name: anchorRadius
attribute.span: Lets you specify "set" specific radius (in pixels) of the anchor.

attribute.name: anchorBorderColor
attribute.span: Lets you specify "set" specific border color of the anchor.

attribute.name: anchorBorderThickness
attribute.span: Lets you specify "set" specific border thickness of the anchor.

attribute.name: color
attribute.span: This attribute defines the color of vertical separator line.

attribute.name: thickness
attribute.span: Thickness in pixels of the vertical separator line.

attribute.name: alpha
attribute.span: Alpha of the vertical separator line.

attribute.name: dashed
attribute.span: Whether the vertical separator line should appear as dashed.

attribute.name: dashLen
attribute.span: If the vertical separator line is to appear as dashed, this attribute defines the length of dash.

attribute.name: dashGap
attribute.span: If the vertical separator line is to appear as dashed, this attribute defines the length of dash gap.

attribute.name: label
attribute.range: Label for the vertical separator line, if to be shown.

attrtable.attribute: Whether to show a border around the vLine label.

Helps configure the position of vertical line i.e., if a vLine is to be plotted between 2 points Jan and Feb, user can set any position between 0 and 1 to indicate the relative position of vLine between these two points (0 means Jan and 1 means Feb). By default, it’s 0.5 to show in between the points.

Helps configure the position of the vLine label by setting a relative position between 0 and 1. In vertical charts, 0 means top of canvas and 1 means bottom. In horizontal charts, 0 means left of canvas and 1 means right.
Horizontal anchor point for the alignment of vLine label.
Vertical anchor point for the alignment of vLine label.

attribute.name: valueOnRight
attribute.span: Whether to show the trend line value on left side or right side of chart. This is particularly useful when the trend line display values on the chart are colliding with divisional lines values on the chart.

attribute.name: color
attribute.span: Color of the trend line and its associated text.

attribute.name: isTrendZone
attribute.span: Whether the trend will display a line, or a zone (filled colored rectangle).

attribute.name: showOnTop
attribute.span: Whether the trend line/zone will be displayed over data plots or under them.

attribute.name: thickness
attribute.span: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define the thickness of trend line.

attribute.name: alpha
attribute.span: Alpha of the trend line.

attribute.name: dashed
attribute.span: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define whether the trend line will appear as dashed.

attribute.name: dashLen
attribute.span: If you've opted to show trend line as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash.

attribute.name: dashGap
attribute.span: If you've opted to show trend line as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash gap.

attribute.name: startValue
attribute.span: The starting value for the trendline. Say, if you want to plot a slanted trendline from value 102 to 109, the
startValue
will be 102.

attribute.name: endValue
attribute.span: endValue
will be 109. If you do not specify a value for
endValue
, it will automatically assume the same value as
startValue

attribute.name: displayValue
